thread.title: Pa. Lawmaker Wants Bridge Named For Vet Named For Joe Biden
thread.title_full: Pa. Lawmaker Wants Bridge Named For Vet Named For Joe Biden

author: CBS Pittsburgh
title: Pa. Lawmaker Wants Bridge Named For Vet Named For Joe Biden
text:
Pa. Lawmaker Wants Bridge Named For Vet Named For Joe Biden February 3, 2017 11:45 AM Filed Under: Joe Biden , Scranton (Photo Credit: KDKA) 
SCRANTON, Pa. (AP) – The City Council in former Vice President Joe Biden’s Pennsylvania hometown is trying to stop a state lawmaker from naming a bridge after Biden. 
Scranton Councilman Pat Rogan says he loves Biden “as much as almost every other Scrantonian,” but he says the bridge being constructed is already named for a veteran. 
The Col. Frank Duffy Memorial Bridge honors the city’s highest-ranking soldier killed in World War I. 
Democratic state Rep. Kevin Haggerty tells the Scranton Times-Tribune he plans to submit a bill to call the bridge the “Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. Bridge.” 
Rogan says the council plans to send Haggerty a letter asking him to find another way to honor Biden. 
Democratic state Sen. John Blake sponsored the 2015 bill to name the bridge after Duffy.
